pullRequest.body:
Turns out that this follows trivially from the previous counterexample.

Perhaps there's a slicker proof that doesn't go via Clifford algebras at all, but it seemed worth recording this one anyway.

---

nodes.body: It shouldn't be too hard to use [LinearMap.toQuadraticForm](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/QuadraticForm/Basic.html#LinearMap.toQuadraticForm) instead, right?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7975186316/job/21772777218)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7975186316/job/21772777471)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7975186316/job/21772777692)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [← sub_zero Q] at hB ```
in the definition of $Q$ above, it should be $Q(\overline{ax+by+cz})=a^2+b^2+c^2$.
It seems there is a positive result: if a quadratic form is induced by a bilinear form, then the algebraMap to the clifford algebra is injective.

Correct; this is in fact a consequence of a (trivial) generalization of `equivExterior`; for now, that definition assumes `Invertible (2 : R)` instead of `IsInducedByBilinear Q`, as the latter does not exist as a typeclass.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Counterexamples/CliffordAlgebra_not_injective): Some quadratic forms cannot be constructed from bilinear forms

nodes.body: It shouldn't be too hard to use [LinearMap.toQuadraticForm](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/QuadraticForm/Basic.html#LinearMap.toQuadraticForm) instead, right?

Pull request successfully merged into master.
